Description: Sherd, mended from two fragments, of North Ionian Late Wild Goat style pottery bowl; white slip. Exterior: at least three friezes separated by bands with added red bands lined in white; uppermost, in black-figure, lower part of feline to right; central, goat grazing to left; below, rump of goat to right. Interior: two friezes in reserving technique separated by band with added red band lined in white: to outside, lotus and bud; to centre, goat grazing to right.
Curator's comments: GR 1924,1201,235, 943-949 and 971 probably all belong to the same bowl, with some doubt about 948a; on the inside it has key maeander at the rim above lotus and bud frieze; there are two goat friezes below. Outside has key maeander at rim, black-figure animals in handle zone, and two goat friezes below, above a lotus band near the foot. On 948a there appears the only goat with reversed head.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.950)
